name: fox-kitten

procedures: T1003.001::[Fox Kitten] has used prodump to dump credentials from LSASS.
T1003.003::[Fox Kitten] has used Volume Shadow Copy to access credential information from NTDS.
T1005::[Fox Kitten] has searched local system resources to access sensitive documents.
T1012::[Fox Kitten] has accessed Registry hives ntuser.dat and UserClass.dat.
T1018::[Fox Kitten] has used Angry IP Scanner to detect remote systems.
T1021.001::[Fox Kitten] has used RDP to log in and move laterally in the target environment.
T1021.002::[Fox Kitten] has used valid accounts to access SMB shares.
T1021.004::[Fox Kitten] has used the PuTTY and Plink tools for lateral movement.
T1021.005::[Fox Kitten] has installed TightVNC server and client on compromised servers and endpoints for lateral movement.
T1027.010::[Fox Kitten] has base64 encoded scripts to avoid detection.
T1027::[Fox Kitten] has base64 encoded payloads to avoid detection.
T1036.004::[Fox Kitten] has named the task for a reverse proxy lpupdate to appear legitimate.
T1036.005::[Fox Kitten] has named binaries and configuration files svhost and dllhost respectively to appear legitimate.
T1039::[Fox Kitten] has searched network shares to access sensitive documents.
T1046::[Fox Kitten] has used tools including NMAP to conduct broad scanning to identify open ports.
T1053.005::[Fox Kitten] has used Scheduled Tasks for persistence and to load and execute a reverse proxy binary.
T1059.001::[Fox Kitten] has used PowerShell scripts to access credential data.
T1059.003::[Fox Kitten] has used cmd.exe likely as a password changing mechanism.
T1059::[Fox Kitten] has used a Perl reverse shell to communicate with C2.
T1078::[Fox Kitten] has used valid credentials with various services during lateral movement.
T1083::[Fox Kitten] has used WizTree to obtain network files and directory listings.
T1087.001::[Fox Kitten] has accessed ntuser.dat and UserClass.dat on compromised hosts.
T1087.002::[Fox Kitten] has used the Softerra LDAP browser to browse documentation on service accounts.
T1090::[Fox Kitten] has used the open source reverse proxy tools including FRPC and Go Proxy to establish connections from C2 to local servers.
T1102::[Fox Kitten] has used Amazon Web Services to host C2.
T1105::[Fox Kitten] has downloaded additional tools including [PsExec] directly to endpoints.
T1110::[Fox Kitten] has brute forced RDP credentials.
T1136.001::[Fox Kitten] has created a local user account with administrator privileges.
T1190::[Fox Kitten] has exploited known vulnerabilities in Fortinet, PulseSecure, and Palo Alto VPN appliances.
T1210::[Fox Kitten] has exploited known vulnerabilities in remote services including RDP.
T1213::[Fox Kitten] has accessed victim security and IT environments and Microsoft Teams to mine valuable information.
T1217::[Fox Kitten] has used Google Chrome bookmarks to identify internal resources and assets.
T1505.003::[Fox Kitten] has installed web shells on compromised hosts to maintain access.
T1530::[Fox Kitten] has obtained files from the victim's cloud storage instances.
T1546.008::[Fox Kitten] has used sticky keys to launch a command prompt.
T1552.001::[Fox Kitten] has accessed files to gain valid credentials.
T1555.005::[Fox Kitten] has used scripts to access credential information from the KeePass database.
T1560.001::[Fox Kitten] has used 7-Zip to archive data.
T1572::[Fox Kitten] has used protocol tunneling for communication and RDP activity on compromised hosts through the use of open source tools such as [Ngrok] and custom tool SSHMinion.
T1585.001::[Fox Kitten] has used a Twitter account to communicate with ransomware victims.
T1585::[Fox Kitten] has created KeyBase accounts to communicate with ransomware victims.

description: [Fox Kitten](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0117) is threat actor with a suspected nexus to the Iranian government that has been active since at least 2017 against entities in the Middle East, North Africa, Europe, Australia, and North America. [Fox Kitten](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0117) has targeted multiple industrial verticals including oil and gas, technology, government, defense, healthcare, manufacturing, and engineering.(Citation: ClearkSky Fox Kitten February 2020)(Citation: CrowdStrike PIONEER KITTEN August 2020)(Citation: Dragos PARISITE )(Citation: ClearSky Pay2Kitten December 2020)
